Description: Rim, body and handle sherd (mended from two fragments) of Attic black-figured pottery lidless lekanis; interior glazed streaky black; on top of rim three rows of messy dots; handle black on outside, reserved on inside; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of siren and swan to right (of siren, only wing with added red and tail feathers remaining, to left; swan crouches under handle, head missing; red on wing and tail); incised splinter rosettes with red as filling ornament.
Producer name: Attributed to the Manner of: The Polos Painter
Curator's comments: The sherd belongs to the same vase as British Museum 1886,0401.1277. For parallels, see Venit (1984, 151-2, figs. 17-22).
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B102.29.2)
Beazley 1944 / Groups of Early Attic Black Figure (p. 55, no. 3)
Venit 1984 / Early Attic Black Figure Vases in Egypt (p. 151, note 67, no. 13)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0760) (Phase 1)
